ai.summary: A 10.4 km moderate heritage-themed city walk through Norwich’s historic streets, weaving past architectural landmarks and telling stories from medieval times to the present day.
ai.terrain_summary: Primarily paved city streets and pavements with a few cobbled sections; gentle gradients in the city center and near historic sites. Expect occasional uneven surfaces and minor stairs near older buildings.
ai.safety_notes: Be mindful of busy urban streets and vehicle traffic; stick to sidewalks and crossing points. Wear sturdy footwear for cobbles and uneven paving. Check the weather in advance and bring a light layer or rain jacket. Carry water and a map or offline route access, and have a plan for meeting points in crowded areas.
ai.best_seasons: Spring to Autumn (roughly March–October); winter is doable with proper layers and traction.

seo.title: Norwich Heritage Walk – 10.4 km Moderate Historic City Walk in the UK
seo.meta_description: Discover Norwich on a 10.4 km moderate heritage walk through historic streets and landmarks. Practical tips on terrain, safety, and gear for UK walkers.
